progetto.network

Class ClientConnection

  • java.lang.Object
    • progetto.network.ClientConnection
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public final class ClientConnection
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable
    Client connection is the object encapsulating the the INetworkClient implementations that provide to the client all the method needed to communicate with the server. All request sending methods are synchronized, so requests can be performed from any thread.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ClientConnection

        public ClientConnection(INetworkClient h,
                        ISync ogg)
        creates a client connection. This will start the thread that processes the pending enforces sent by the server
        Parameters:
        h - the INetworkClient implementation that must be used to exchange message with the server.
        ogg - the synchronization object that will be used in this session. The object will be cleared.

      • fetchServerState

        public void fetchServerState()
        ask the server for the current state of the server

      • getPlayerID

        public int getPlayerID()
        Returns:
        the id of the player. Player id cannot change at run time, but can be equal to -1 if the server did not yet sent the value that will be used this model

      • setPlayerID

        final void setPlayerID(int plID)
        set the id of the current player
        Parameters:

        Parameters:

        playerName - the name with which you will be called.

      • checkSync

        final void checkSync(int state,
                     int hash)
        checks if the state of the object is correct
        Parameters:
        state - index of hash that must be compared
        hash - hash received by the server

      • getMessageCallback

        public Callback<java.lang.String> getMessageCallback()
        Returns:
        the callback that is called when a message is received by the network. Notice that messages are not processed from the enforce processing thread, therefore if can be triggered at any time.

      • setFullState

        final void setFullState(java.util.List<java.io.Serializable> commands)
        reload the entire state of the syncObject
        Parameters:
        commands - new state

      • getChair

        public int getChair()
        Returns:
        the chair currently used by this chair, -1 if he is not in a room

      • isReady

        public boolean isReady()
        Returns:
        the ready status of this player, false if he is not in a room

        Parameters:

        Returns:
